title: SMC_GetCyclicMapping (Function)
text:
FUNCTION SMC_GetCyclicMapping
Returns information about a parameter that is cyclically mapped, such as
the actual position, the set position, the control word, or the status word.
The function block will return where in the process image this cyclic
data is located.  This internal information usually is not necessary in the
application.  There are special cases, e.g. if the axis has ben set to
controller mode
SMC_nocontrol
, and the control word should be written
by the application.  In such a case, you can query the address of the
control word using this function, given the driver-specific parameter number
of the control word.
For CiA-402 based drivers, you can find the parameter numbers in the
GVL SMC_ParamNum_CiA402 of library SM3_Drive_CiA_DSP402.
Parameter numbers for other parameters can be found in the
documentation of
AXIS_REF_SM3
.
Only use the returned information if you know what you are doing,
as it can interfere with the SoftMotion driver.

rows.Name: ParameterNumber
rows.Comment:
The SoftMotion parameter number of the parameter that
is cyclically mapped.

rows.Name: Valid
rows.Comment: Whether the parameter is cyclically mapped

rows: The address where the value of the parameter is located.
A bit mask to the portion of a DWORD where the value resides
The bit offset in the DWORD
The length of the value in bits.
